channel.title: Java
channel.description:
So I started learning Java and currently using Bucky's (thenewboston on Youtube) video tutorials. They seem to be doing pretty good so far, but I rather read a book once in a while than watch videos all the time. Since well a lot of people here know Java, I'd like to ask for some advice and a few directions.
1) What kind of book should I look for? And specific book titles would be nice as well.
2) Any websites out there that can help with my Java learning?
3) A few years back, I heard that there was some kind of website with Java exercises that can help newbies like myself. Anybody still got the link to that?
4) Pros and Cons of a Java programmer.
5) Any additional detail, pointers, or otherwise would be appreciated.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Java

@m.dog311 wrote:

con: ???
[/quote]

Having to work in a bank and write Java all day…[/quote]
I’d rather use Java than Ruby…

Read full topic

item.description:
@Erj wrote:

[quote=“Adam, post:6, topic:411570”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=512823.msg3723165#msg3723165 date=1314078714]

Thanks. I just noticed the Java board’s sticky lol. Been a member for years and only found out now that there was a board dedicated to Java XD.
[/quote]How the fuck did you manage this…

He only comes here to fap.[/quote]
Yes because only witty replies turn me on. Hold on right there:
FAP FAP FAP FAP FAP… I’m done.
